document.docAuthor: Chen, Hui-Ming, Jia, Qiang & Wang, Shi-Jie
document.docTitle: Qianleptoneta megaloda Chen & Jia & Wang 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Qianleptoneta (Araneae: Leptonetidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Qianleptoneta (Araneae: Leptonetidae)

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype male.
From Yanzi Cave (
28 ◦ 17 ′ N
,
106 ◦ 09 ′ E
,
1231 m asl
), Sangmu town , Xishui county , Guizhou Province ,

.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 23.
Qianleptoneta megaloda
sp. nov. , male holotype and female paratype: (A) male left palp, prolateral view; (B) male left palp, retrolateral view; (C) male left chelicerae, ventral view; (D) female left chelicerae, ventral view; (E) female genitalia, ventral view; (F) female genitalia, dorsal view.

Figure 24.
Qianleptoneta megaloda
sp. nov. , male holotype and female paratype: (A) male habitus, lateral view; (B) male carapace, dorsal view; (C) female habitus, lateral view; (D) female carapace, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes .
Two males and seven females , same data as holotype; one male , Gao Cave (
28 ◦ 20 ′ N
,
106 ◦ 10 ′ E
,
1227 m asl
), Donghuang town , Xishui county , Guizhou Province ,
26 July 2004
;
one male and 10 females , Dixian Cave (
28 ◦ 20 ′ N
,
106 ◦ 09 ′ E
,
1224 m asl
), Donghuang town , Xishui county , Guizhou Province ,
25 July 2004
.

Male holotype .
Total length 1.89. Carapace smooth, 0.87 long, 0.77 wide, height at fovea 0.66 times carapace width, yellowish; thoracic fovea brown, needle-shaped. Clypeus 0.18 high, yellowish. Chelicerae 0.46 long, yellowish, with eight teeth on promargin and five denticles on retromargin; seven short setae on base ( Figure 23C ). Six eyes; ocular area 0.22 long, 0.19 wide; anterior row strongly recurved, ALE 0.08, PLE 0.06, PLE–PLE 0.09; PME 0.06, slightly smaller than anterior row eyes, contiguous; dark pigment between eyes ( Figure 24B ). Sternum 0.61 long, 0.53 wide, haired; labium 0.10 long, 0.17 wide, yellowish.

Leg measurements (femur + patella + tibia + metatarsus + tarsus = total): I: 1.63 + lack + lack + lack + lack =?; II: 1.68 + 0.31 + 1.73 + 1.28 + 1.02 = 6.02; III: 1.43 + 0.23 + 1.33 + 1.12 + 0.77 = 4.90; IV: 1.84 + 0.31 + 1.84 + 1.48 + 1.04 = 6.48. Leg yellowish, tibia without rows of fine hairs on ventral surface; preening comb occurs ventroapically on the metatarsus of leg II and III.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 25.
Qianleptoneta species
, M and C of left palpal bulb in ventral view: (A)
Q. quinquespinata Chen and Zhu, 2008
; (B)

sp. nov ; (C)

sp. nov ; (E)
Q. multiseta
sp. nov ; (F)
Q. robustispina
sp. nov ; (G)
Q. palmata
sp. nov ; (H)
Q. sublunata
sp. nov ; (I)
Q. megaloda
sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Leg formula: 1423. Leg measurements (femur + patella + tibia + metatarsus + tarsus = total): I: 1.94 + 0.31 + 2.09 + 1.53 + 1.28 = 7.14; II: 1.53 + 0.31 + 1.53 + 1.22 + 0.48 = 6.07; III: 1.28 + 0.31 + 1.28 + 1.02 + 0.82 = 4.69; IV: 1.79 + 0.31 + 1.73 + 1.38 + 0.97 = 6.17. Leg yellowish, preening comb occurs ventroapically on the metatarsus of leg II and III.
Palpal coxae 0.39 long, 0.17 wide. Palpal measurements (femur + patella + tibia + tarsus = total): 0.54 + 0.21 + 0.40 + 0.60 = 1.74.
The species is known only from the type locality ( Figure 2 ).

The specific name comes from Latin “
megaloda
” meaning “big teeth”, referring to median apophysis of male palpal organ (M) with six big teeth at apical part ( Figure 25I ).
This species lives in the twilight zone of caves and has functioning eyes and pigmentation. Troglophilous species.

Yanzi Cave is about 800 m horizontally deep, 40 m high and 20 m wide, entrance about 30 m high and 20 m wide. Cave is large with a great underground river. Gao Cave is about 100 m horizontally deep, 10 m high and 5 m wide, entrance about 5 m high and 3 m wide. Cave is small with an underground deep pool. Dixian Cave is about 50 m horizontally deep, 4 m high and 5 m wide, entrance about 3 m high and 3 m wide. Cave is small with a small stream flow inside. All specimens were found near the twilight zone, about 20 m from the entrance.
